FuncDef: The pki delete-certificate command deletes a certificate from the memory. The pki delete-certificate command deletes a certificate from the memory.
CLIs: pki delete-certificate { ca | local } { realm <realm-name> | filename <file-name> }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of the PKI realm to which a certificate belongs.
The value must be an existing PKI realm name.

Specifies the name of a certificate file.
The value must be an existing certificate file name.

Deletes an Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) server's certificate.
-

ExtraInfo: When the certificate expires or you want to apply for a new certificate, run this command to delete the CA certificate or local certificate from the memory.
